intro: Piriqueta seticarpa, commonly known as the stiff-haired piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, stiff, hairless leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular florets. Piriqueta seticarpa is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
